# Branch

1. `git branch <branch_name>`
1. `git checkout <branch_name>`
1. Add some new files
1. Stage and commit your new files
1. Checkout the main branch  (remember `git branch -a` will list all branches)
1. Go back to (checkout) the branch you created
1. Add another file
1. Stage and commit your new files
1. Push the new branch (new files) up to GitHub
1. Explore how you can navigate branches at GitHub
1. Merge the changes into the main branch

    1. Checkout the main branch (back at C9)
    1. `git merge <branch_name>`

1. Stage, commit, and push back up to the GitHub remote
1. Explore how the branch differs from the main (`master`)
